result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald William Vallery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 10:05 am cases called-16CF62 & 17CF80. Defendant Ronald William Vallery in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI received by both counsel-no corrections or additions by Attorney Lennon. ADA Anderson makes statement regarding corrections to PSI-stated on the record. Statement by Agent Michael Austin, special agent with WIDOR-victim statement made to Court. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Lennon. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 16CF62-SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: 3 months WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. To begin no later than January 15, 2018. AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to include Attorney Lennon's fees be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. 17CF80-COUNT 5: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 4 years. Concurrent to 16CF62. CONDITIONS: 9 months WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. Consecutive to 16CF62. No credit for time served. To begin no later than January 15, 2018. Restitution of $11,806.40 to be paid in increments of no less than $250.00 per month commencing March 1, 2018. AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to include Attorney Lennon's fees be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Defendant may petition for early termination of probation after a period of 3 years provided conditions of probation have been complated. Appeal Rights Given. COUNT 4-Same conditions as to Count 5-no conditional jail.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Acceptance of Plea Offer - Ordered Sealed by the Court
Sentencing hearing on January 5, 2018 at 10:00 am.

16CF-62, 17CF-80, 17CF-213 and 17CF-214 16CV-47 also - All Cases Called @ 1:50 PM: Defendant Ronald William Vallery in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Per ADA - global resolution has been reached with a request for PSI.  Atty Lennon confirms that Def will accept State's written plea offer and terms outlined and confirms request will be made for PSI.  Court reviews rejection letter provided and recites agreement of the parties with expected argued terms at SEH.   ADA, Def and counsel concur with the Court's recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing as to 16CF-62 and 17CF-80.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety as to 16CF-62 and 17CF-80.  Def BOT.  INFO's filed.  INFO's both stated.  Receipt Admitted and Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.   Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court instructs Def that terms of bond continue pending SEH and consequences for potentially violating bond and jeopardizing this agreement.  16CF-62 Plea Ct 1 INFO:  NC  17CF-80 Plea Ct 4 and 5 INFO:  NC  16CF-62 Ct 2, 17CF-80 Cts 1, 2 and 3, 17CF-213 and 17CF-214 all DRI.   Asset Forfeiture of 16CV-47 is proper and Court orders as forfeited the US currency of $5360.00 and as per Chapter 961 to be distributed.  Court accepts the 3 pleas and enters JOC to each.  In accordance with counsel's request, Court orders preparation of PSI thru DOC.  SEH scheduled accordingly.  Court reminds Def that firearm prohibition is now in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

9:00 am cases called-16CV47, 16CF62, 17CF80, 17CF213 & 17CF214. Defendant Ronald William Vallery in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding status of matters. Attorney Lennon updates court as to status. 17CF80-will most likely go to trial. 16CF62 will go to plea with request for PSI. 17CF213 & 17CF214-would not object to being appointed and serving and requests additional counsel be appointed to assist with cases due to nature of charges. Court goes over matters and respectfully declines to appoint a second attorney. Court sets final PTC. Court questions counsel regarding INIT-Attorney Lennon will accept appointment on 17CF213 & 17CF214 and requests INIT to be held at a later date. 17CF213 & 17CF214-Court conducts Bond hearing-Complaint stated. Bond recommendation by both counsel. Court sets bond -applies to both cases-$5000 Signature Bond with conditions. Riverside Ruling on both complaints. Court orders by November 15, 2017 defendant to pay $1000 to the Clerk of Courts office-and orders payments of $500 per month commencing January 1, 2018 to cover all open cases at this time. Court sets all matters for November 3, 2017 at 1:30 pm.

17CF80, 16CF-62 and 16CF-47 - All Cases Called @ 1:53 pm: Defendant Ronald William Vallery in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes for the record that previous counsel has withdrawn.  Def states he was found ineligible for SPD services due to income.  Def requests Court Appointment.  Further statement as to counsel by Def and his inability to retain new counsel.  Court will appoint counsel upon the payment of $1000 no later than this Friday, 9/15/17.  Commencing 10/1/2017 maintain a $200 payment plan as to all these cases.   The Court does not find Def eligible for a county appointment based upon income.  Def confirms that he has received the offer on resolution from his prior counsel and DA confirms that offer remains on the table at this time.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2017 at 02:20 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Ronald William Vallery in court with attorney John Andrew Newton.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  DA argues as to $5000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by Atty Newton.  The Court:  Orders $5000 Signature Bond as requested.  Counsel intend to work toward resolution of Waupaca Co as well.  Court orders a stay of asset forfeiture action commenced by the State as to 16CV-47 as to its merits and to track along the same calendar.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:05 am.
